This creates a new lock, so this manager cannot have an existing lock in place for the caller.","params":{"_allowance":"Amount of tokens the manager will be allowed to lock","_data":"Optional, arbitrary data to be submitted to the manager","_lockManager":"Lock manager"}},"canUnlock(address,address,address,uint256)":{"details":"Check if `_sender` can unlock `@tokenAmount(self.token(): address, _amount)` from `_user`'s lock managed by `_lockManager`","params":{"_amount":"Amount of locked tokens to unlock. If zero, the full locked amount.","_lockManager":"Lock manager","_sender":"Address that would try to unlock tokens","_user":"Owner of lock"},"return":"Whether sender is allowed to unlock tokens from the given lock"},"constructor":{"params":{"_token":"ERC20 token used for staking"}},"decreaseLockAllowance(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"Callable only by the user or lock manager.     Cannot completely remove the allowance to the lock manager (and deactivate the lock).","params":{"_allowance":"Amount to decrease allowance by","_lockManager":"Lock manager","_user":"Owner of the locked tokens"}},"getBalancesOf(address)":{"details":"Tell the current staked and locked balances for `_user`","params":{"_user":"Address"},"return":"Staked balanceLocked balance"},"getLock(address,address)":{"details":"Tell details of `_user`'s lock managed by `_lockManager`","params":{"_lockManager":"Lock manager","_user":"Address"},"return":"Amount of locked tokensAmount of tokens that lock manager is allowed to lock"},"increaseLockAllowance(address,uint256)":{"details":"Callable only by a user","params":{"_allowance":"Amount to increase allowance by","_lockManager":"Lock manager"}},"lastStakedFor(address)":{"details":"Tell the last time `_user` modified their staked balance","params":{"_user":"Address"},"return":"Last block number the account's staked balance was modified. 0 if it has never been modified."},"lock(address,uint256)":{"details":"Callable only by an allowed lock manager","params":{"_amount":"Amount of tokens to lock","_user":"Owner of the locked tokens"}},"lockedBalanceOf(address)":{"details":"Tell the current locked balance for `_user`","params":{"_user":"Address"},"return":"Amount of locked tokens owned by the requested account across all locks"},"receiveApproval(address,uint256,address,bytes)":{"details":"ApproveAndCallFallBack compliance.     Stakes the approved tokens for the user, allowing users to stake their tokens in a single transaction.     Callable only by the staking token.","params":{"_amount":"Amount of tokens being approved","_data":"Optional data emitted with the Staked event, to add signalling information in more complex staking applications","_from":"Account approving tokens","_token":"Token being approved, should be the caller"}},"slash(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"Callable only by a lock      and the lock manager allows to unlock.

nodes.documentation: @dev This is similar to a `_transfer()` followed by a `_unstake()`, but optimized to avoid spurious SSTOREs on modifying _to's checkpointed balance

nodes.name: _unstake

nodes.documentation:
@dev Assumes `canUnlock` passes, i.e., either sender is the lock manager or it’s the owner,
     and the lock manager allows to unlock.
nodes.name: _unlockUnsafe

nodes.documentation: @dev This is similar to a `_transfer()` followed by a `_unstake()`, but optimized to avoid spurious SSTOREs on modifying _to's checkpointed balance
nodes.name: _transferAndUnstake

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (struct Checkpointing.History storage pointer) view returns (uint256)
function (struct Checkpointing.History storage pointer) view returns (uint256)

nodes.name: _canUnlockUnsafe

allowManager(address,uint256,bytes).details: Callable only by a user.     This creates a new lock, so this manager cannot have an existing lock in place for the caller.

params._allowance: Amount of tokens the manager will be allowed to lock
params._data: Optional, arbitrary data to be submitted to the manager

canUnlock(address,address,address,uint25.details: Check if `_sender` can unlock `@tokenAmount(self.token(): address, _amount)` from `_user`'s lock managed by `_lockManager`

params._amount: Amount of locked tokens to unlock. If zero, the full locked amount.
params._sender: Address that would try to unlock tokens

canUnlock(address,address,address,uint25.return: Whether sender is allowed to unlock tokens from the given lock

decreaseLockAllowance(address,address,ui.details: Callable only by the user or lock manager.     Cannot completely remove the allowance to the lock manager (and deactivate the lock).

getBalancesOf(address).details: Tell the current staked and locked balances for `_user`

getLock(address,address).details: Tell details of `_user`'s lock managed by `_lockManager`
getLock(address,address).return: Amount of locked tokensAmount of tokens that lock manager is allowed to lock

lastStakedFor(address).details: Tell the last time `_user` modified their staked balance
lastStakedFor(address).return: Last block number the account's staked balance was modified. 0 if it has never been modified.

lock(address,uint256).details: Callable only by an allowed lock manager

lockedBalanceOf(address).details: Tell the current locked balance for `_user`
lockedBalanceOf(address).return: Amount of locked tokens owned by the requested account across all locks

receiveApproval(address,uint256,address,.details: ApproveAndCallFallBack compliance.     Stakes the approved tokens for the user, allowing users to stake their tokens in a single transaction.     Callable only by the staking token.

params._data: Optional data emitted with the Staked event, to add signalling information in more complex staking applications
params._token: Token being approved, should be the caller

slash(address,address,uint256).details: Callable only by a lock manager

params._amount: Amount of tokens to be transferred via slashing

slashAndUnlock(address,address,uint256,u.details: Callable only by a lock manager

params._slashAmount: Amount of tokens to be transferred via slashing
params._unlockAmount: Amount of tokens to be left unlocked

slashAndUnstake(address,address,uint256).details: Callable only by a lock manager

params._amount: Amount of tokens to be transferred via slashing
Amount of tokens to be staked
params._data: Optional data emitted with the Staked event, to add signalling information in more complex staking applications

params._amount: Amount of tokens to be staked
params._data: Optional data emitted with the Staked event, to add signalling information in more complex staking applications

supportsHistory().details: Tell whether the history methods are supported

totalStaked().details: Tell the total staked balance from all users
totalStaked().return: The total amount of staked tokens from all users

totalStakedAt(uint256).details: Tell the total staked balance from all users at block number `_blockNumber`
totalStakedAt(uint256).return: The total amount of staked tokens from all users at the given block number

totalStakedFor(address).details: Tell the current staked balance for `_user`

totalStakedForAt(address,uint256).details: Tell the staked balance for `_user` at block number `_blockNumber`
totalStakedForAt(address,uint256).return: Staked balance at the given block number

params._amount: Amount of tokens to be transferred
Amount of tokens to be transferred

unlock(address,address,uint256).details: Callable only by the user or lock manager. If called by the user, checks with the lock manager whether the request should be allowed.

unlockAndRemoveManager(address,address).details: Callable only by the user or lock manager. If called by the user, checks with the lock manager whether the request should be allowed.

unlockedBalanceOf(address).details: Tell the portion of `user`'s staked balance that can be immediately withdrawn
unlockedBalanceOf(address).return: Amount of tokens available to be withdrawn

params._amount: Amount of tokens to be unstaked
params._data: Optional data emitted with the Unstaked event, to add signalling information in more complex staking applications

allowManager(address,uint256,bytes).notice: Allow `_lockManager` to lock up to `@tokenAmount(self.token(): address, _allowance)` of your staked balance

decreaseLockAllowance(address,address,ui.notice: Decrease allowance of lock manager `_lockManager` by `@tokenAmount(self.token(): address, _allowance)`

increaseLockAllowance(address,uint256).notice: Increase allowance of lock manager `_lockManager` by `@tokenAmount(self.token(): address, _allowance)`

slash(address,address,uint256).notice: Slash `@tokenAmount(self.token(): address, _amount)` from `_from`'s locked balance to `_to`'s staked balance

slashAndUnlock(address,address,uint256,u.notice: Slash `@tokenAmount(self.token(): address, _slashAmount)` from `_from`'s locked balance to `_to`'s staked balance, and leave an additional `@tokenAmount(self.token(): address, _unlockAmount)` unlocked for `_from`

slashAndUnstake(address,address,uint256).notice: Slash `@tokenAmount(self.token(): address, _amount)` from `_from`'s locked balance  directly to `_to`'s balance

unlockAndRemoveManager(address,address).notice: Unlock all tokens from lock manager `_lockManager` and remove them as a manager
